intro: Agallostachys antiacantha, commonly known as the spiked agalloch, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It is often grown as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and pleasant scent. Agallostachys antiacantha prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it suitable for gardens in temperate climates.
